info.name: Cisco DNA Center APIs
info.description:
This is a collection and environment for Cisco Digital Network Architecture Center (DNA-C)
There is a default environment pointing to DevNet always on sandbox.


### What's in this collection?
- Authenticate API.
- Network Discovery and Device Discovery APIs.
- Device Tags APIs.
- Path Trace APIs.
- Network Plug and Play
- Assurance APIs
- Policy Manager APIs
- Software Image Manager APIs
- Command Runner APIs


Note: Make sure you update your Environment Variables with the latest Token and Device information!

To learn more about Cisco DNA Center and Its APIs check out:

https://developer.cisco.com/learning/modules/dnac-rest-apis
https://developer.cisco.com/dnacenter/

request.description: This request uses the "token" variable generated from the POST request to get first 14 network-devices
Example of the /host API
Example of the /interface API
Example of the /interface API
Gets a list of all tags defined on the controller

Finds the tagId for the tag created earlier

this is stored in the tagId environment variable.
Creates a new tag on the controller

Gets a task status.
uses environment variable for the taskId

Associates an existing tag with a network-device.

Tag needs to have been created before it can be associated

network-device is the deviceId environment variable, you need to change this

Gets a task status.
uses environment variable for the taskId

Deletes association between tag and device

you need to delete the association before you can delete the tag
delete tag from controller

Creates a flow analysis.  sourceIP and destIP are specified.

src/dst port can also be provided

Gets a task status.
uses environment variable for the taskId

Also parses the result of the task to find the ID of the path.

This is stored in the pathId environment variable

Gets a flow-analyis
uses environment variable for the pathId

item.name: 5.Network PnP

request.description: Gets a list of all projects defined on the controller
Creates a new project

Gets a task status.
uses environment variable for the taskId

Also parse the progress field to find the ID of the project that was created

this is stored in the projectId environment variable.

Creates a rule for a device in a project.

uses the projectId from the project we created earlier

Gets a task status.
uses environment variable for the taskId

Gets all of the devices for a project
Uses the projectId environment variable

Updates a parameter of the device
Uses the projectNetworkDevice variable from the environment
Also needs projectId environment variable
Delete the project and all rules/devices contained in it

Gets a task status.
uses environment variable for the taskId

Lists all of the config files on the controller.
You can all do the same thing for image files

This uploads a configuration file to the controller.

NOTE: You need to select a file to be uploaded.  CLick on the "body" tab to select a file

NOTENOTE:  This call is synchronous... there is no task

Deletes a configuration file from the controller.

Uses the fileId from the previous POST to delete

item.description:
The order of these requests is important.

The project that is created gets captured as a projectId variable
